title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 8189.11 - Lot subdivision
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 8189.11 - Lot subdivision

State Regulations
(a) When
land parcels are subdivided after the initial numbering, the new land parcels
shall carry the original lot number and a suffix starting with the number one. A total of three unique numbers to the right of the decimal may be suffixed to
the original lot number. Where an original land parcel is extensively altered, it will be necessary to renumber the land parcels. A new coordinate locator
number, which shall not duplicate any previous coordinate locator number used, shall be assigned to each new land parcel. Where a land parcel falls on more
than one map sheet, the map sheet containing the major portion of the land
parcel shall show the assigned lot number and there shall be sufficient
cross-reference between the adjoining portions to that land parcel. (b) The description of lots in a subdivision
may not be changed or altered to indicate the abandonment of a subdivision
unless an instrument abandoning that subdivision has been filed with the
appropriate assessor and recording officer. The instrument abandoning a
subdivision shall include the following information: (1)
signed statements by the county treasurer
and collecting officers of any city, town or village in which the subdivision
is located that all taxes levied against the lots contained in the abandonment
have been paid; (2)
the receipt of
the clerks of those municipalities that the instrument has been filed with
them; and
(3)
if the subdivision is
within a forest preserve county, the consent of ORPTS as evidenced by an
endorsement pursuant to section
2375.3
of
this Title. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20
ยง
8189.11

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
